edge_sources.documentation: Edge plasma sources. Energy terms correspond to the full kinetic energy equation (i.e. the energy flux takes into account the energy transported by the particle flux)

edge_sources.code.documentation: Generic decription of the code-specific parameters for the code that has produced this IDS

edge_sources.code.output_flag.documentation: Output flag : 0 means the run is successful, other values mean some difficulty has been encountered, the exact meaning is then code specific. Negative values mean the result shall not be used.

edge_sources.code.parameters.documentation: List of the code specific parameters in XML format

edge_sources.ids_properties.documentation: Interface Data Structure properties. This element identifies the node above as an IDS

edge_sources.ids_properties.comment.documentation: Any comment describing the content of this IDS

edge_sources.ids_properties.homogeneous_.documentation: 1 if the time of this IDS is homogeneous. In this case, the time values for this IDS are stored in ../time just below the root of this IDS. Otherwise, the time values are stored in the various time fields at lower levels in the tree.

edge_sources.source[:].ggd.documentation: Source terms represented using the general grid description, for various time slices

edge_sources.source[:].ggd[:].current[:].documentation: Interpolation coefficients, to be used for a high precision evaluation of the physical quantity with finite elements, provided per element in the grid subset (first dimension).
Index in the error_description list for "coefficients"
Index of the grid used to represent this quantity
Index of the grid subset the data is provided on
One scalar value is provided per element in the grid subset.
Index in the error_description list for "values"

edge_sources.source[:].ggd[:].electrons..documentation: Source term for the electron energy equation, given on various grid subsets

edge_sources.source[:].ggd[:].grid.grid_.documentation: Set of bases for the grid subset. For each base, the structure describes the projection of the base vectors on the canonical frame of the grid.
Index in the error_description list for "jacobian"
Contravariant metric tensor, given on each element of the subgrid (first dimension)
Index in the error_description list for "tensor_contravariant"
Covariant metric tensor, given on each element of the subgrid (first dimension)
Index in the error_description list for "tensor_covariant"
Space dimension of the grid subset elements. This must be equal to the sum of the dimensions of the individual objects forming the element.
Set of elements defining the grid subset. An element is defined by a combination of objects from potentially all spaces
Set of objects defining the element
Index of the space from which that object is taken
Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list)
Metric of the canonical frame onto Cartesian coordinates
Index in the error_description list for "jacobian"
Contravariant metric tensor, given on each element of the subgrid (first dimension)
Index in the error_description list for "tensor_contravariant"
Covariant metric tensor, given on each element of the subgrid (first dimension)
Index in the error_description list for "tensor_covariant"

edge_sources.source[:].ggd[:].grid.ident.documentation: Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list)

edge_sources.source[:].ggd[:].grid.space.documentation: Set of grid spaces

Type of coordinates describing the physical space, for every coordinate of the space. The size of this node therfore defines the dimension of the space. The meaning of these predefined integer constants can be found in the documentation of the grid service library
Type of space geometry (0: standard, 1:Fourier)
Verbose description
Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list)
Short string identifier

Definition of the space objects for every dimension (from one to the dimension of the highest-dimensional objects). The index correspond to 1=nodes, 2=edges, 3=faces, 4=cells/volumes, .... For every index, a collection of objects of that dimension is described.
Set of objects for a given dimension
Set of  (n-1)-dimensional objects defining the boundary of this n-dimensional object
Index of this (n-1)-dimensional boundary object
List of indices of the n-dimensional objects adjacent to the given n-dimensional object. An object can possibly have multiple neighbours on a boundary
Geometry data associated with the object. Its dimension depends on the type of object, geometry and coordinate considered.
Index in the error_description list for "geometry"
Lower error for "geometry"
Upper error for "geometry"
Measure of the space object, i.e. physical size (length for 1d, area for 2d, volume for 3d objects,...)
Index in the error_description list for "measure"
Lower error for "measure"
Upper error for "measure"
List of nodes forming this object (indices to objects_per_dimension(1)%object(:) in Fortran notation)
